description: Sum_{k<=n} (tau(k^2)), where tau is the number of divisors function A000005.
references: Mentioned by _Steven Finch_ in a posting to the Number Theory List (NMBRTHRY(AT)LISTSERV.NODAK.EDU), Jun 13 2001.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1024
Kevin A. Broughan, Restricted divisor sums, Acta Arithmetica, vol. 101, (2002), pp. 105-114.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{1<=j<=n^2} (floor(n/A019554(j))), - Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)hotmail.com), Jul 20 2002a(n) = Sum(i=1..n, 2^omega(i) * floor(n/i)) . - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Sep 15 2012a(n) ~ 3/Pi^2 * n log^2 n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 08 2012
prog: (PARI) for (n=1, 1024, write("b061503.txt", n, " ", sum(k=1, n, numdiv(k^2)))) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 23 2009(PARI) t=0;v=vector(60,n,t+=numdiv(n^2)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 08 2012(Sage) def A061503(n) :    tau = sloane.A000005    return add(tau(k^2) for k in (1..n))[ A061503(i) for i in (1..19)] # _Peter Luschny_, Sep 15 2012
crossrefs: Cf. A000005, A061502. Partial sums of A048691.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 14 2001
